content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

As a human player, I would choose strategy B {B} for this game. Here's my reasoning:

1. In this repeated game, we can look at it from an evolutionary strategy perspective called Tit-for-Tat (TFT). TFT suggests that it is advantageous to cooperate initially and then mirror the opponent's previous move in subsequent rounds. This approach encourages long-term cooperation while also punishing defections.

2. If my anonymous partner chooses R, I will do better by choosing B (getting 35$ compared to 0$) in the first round. In the TFT strategy, I would then mirror their move (choosing R) in subsequent rounds if they continue with R; otherwise, I'll switch back to B after a defection.

3. If my anonymous partner chooses B, I will do better by mirroring their choice and choosing B as well (getting 40$ compared to 45$). In the TFT strategy, I would then continue choosing B in subsequent rounds if they stick with B; otherwise, I'll switch back to R after a defection.

4. The key advantage of this approach is that I am more likely to earn a higher average payoff (>35$) over the 75 rounds by encouraging cooperation while also punishing defections. Since we don't know the strategy of my opponent, it seems rational to follow TFT and choose B {B}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 40$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

As a human player following the Tit-for-Tat (TFT) strategy, I would choose R {R} for the next round since my opponent chose B in the previous round and we both earned 40$ each. This way, I am mirroring their choice from the previous round.
